The vine that ate the American southeast. Kudzu was brought to America from Japan,
because it was a cute little ornamental vine with purple flowers and it smelled like laffy taffy.

that was introduced to Guam during WWII and pretty much collapsed the entire ecosystem of the island.

it has some successes, it also has some pretty tremendous failures. For example,
